definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: In particular this means that this file is not malicious but a false alarm .
sentences.chinese: 這意味着，這個文件是沒有惡意的，只是虛驚一場。

sentences.english: Maybe it was just a false alarm.
sentences.chinese: 或許只是一場虛驚罷了。

sentences.english: Federal authorities are now saying a possible assassination plot against Barack Obama posed no credible threat.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦政府稱可能對奧巴馬的刺殺陰謀只是一場虛驚。

sentences.english: I overreact frequently and experience many false alarms.
sentences.chinese: 我經常反應過度，經常虛驚一場。

sentences.english: Police have now confirmed it was a false alarm.
sentences.chinese: 目前，警方已證實這是一場虛驚。

sentences.english: The troops (were) stood down: it was a false alarm.
sentences.chinese: 部隊解除了戒備狀態，原來是虛驚一場。

sentences.english: But not so easily did Elinor recover from the alarm into which it had thrown her.
sentences.chinese: 但是埃麗諾受了這場虛驚，卻不那麼容易恢復鎮靜。

sentences.english: A false alarm or a heart attack averted or maybe a lab error?
sentences.chinese: 心臟病發作是一場虛驚，還是實驗室檢查有誤？

sentences.english: Bosnia and Herzegovina a few times in the game hit the goal post, which makes Portugal a false alarm.
sentences.chinese: 波黑在比賽中幾次擊中門柱，這讓葡萄牙虛驚一場。

sentences.english: Looks like the first report was a false alarm.
sentences.chinese: 好像第一次報告是一場虛驚。

sentences.english: The alarm system went wrong and created a false alarm.
sentences.chinese: 報警系統失靈，引起一場虛驚。

sentences.english: It sounds just like a false alarm.
The incident was described as a well-intentioned false alarm.
sentences.chinese: 這起事件被形容是善意的一場虛驚。

sentences.english: " transaction volume zero "but said it is a false alarm.
sentences.chinese: “交易量爲零”之說不過是一場虛驚。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
